properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 16 at 12:20AM CST until January 18 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Des Moines IA
properties.description:
...Bitter Wind Chills Tonight, Winter Storm Arrives Friday...

.Falling temperatures tonight and blustery northwest winds will
lead to bitter cold wind chills of -20 to -25 tonight into
Thursday morning across north central Iowa. Snowfall returns
Friday morning as a winter storm takes aim on the region. The
snow may be heavy at times during the morning and afternoon hours
before transitioning into a period of light wintry mix or
freezing rain. Strong northwest winds will develop Saturday which
could lead to areas of blowing snow, in addition to lingering
light snowfall Saturday morning. Highest snowfall accumulations
nearing 6 inches will reside in north central Iowa with lesser
amounts of 3 to 4 inches further south.

* WHAT...For the wind chill advisory, bitter cold wind chills
expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter
Storm Watch, total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches and ice
accumulations of around one tenth of an inch possible. Winds
could gust as high as 50 mph Saturday and create areas of
blowing snow.

* WHERE...North central Iowa.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to
9 AM CST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 6 am
Friday to 6pm Saturday. Snow begins Friday morning and may be
heavy at times into the afternoon hours. Snowfall then changes
over to light wintry mix or freezing rain Friday evening.
Additional light snowfall possible late Friday night into
early Saturday.

* IMPACTS...The cold wind chills tonight could cause frostbite
on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Plan on hazardous
travel conditions developing Friday, which could impact the
morning and evening commutes. Areas of blowing snow could
significantly reduce visibility Friday into Saturday.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a
hat, and gloves.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON
